byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens, and Jim Yardley from Rome. Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.
byline.original: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and JIM YARDLEY

abstract: Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras announces call for national elections and says he will submit his resignation to Greece's president; move, part of effort to solidify his power and push forward with agreed-upon bailout plan with European creditors, clears way for vote on whether Tsipras and his leftist Syriza party will be returned to power with fresh mandate from Greek public.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Tsipras, facing a revolt in his party over a bailout package, said he would submit his resignation and ask for new elections to be held on Sept. 20.

headline.main: Alexis Tsipras, Greek Prime Minister, Calls for New Elections
headline.print_headline: Greek Premier Calls for New Elections in Effort to Solidify His Hold

snippet: Mr. Tsipras, facing a revolt in his party over a bailout package, said he would submit his resignation and ask for new elections to be held on Sept. 20.
